com.sri.ai.util.functionalsequence

Class AbstractRefiner<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.util.functionalsequence.AbstractRefiner<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the value being computed.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Refiner<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFunctionalRefiner, IteratorRefiner

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractRefiner<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Refiner<T>
    A basic abstract implementation of Refiner. Extensions only need to implement refineOrNull(), which must return either a refinement of the current value (available at currentValue), or null if that is not possible.

    refineOrNull() can choose to set knownToBeOver if it determines that no further refinements in the future will be possible even if the present invocation of refineOrNull() was successful. This will avoid unnecessary subsequent calls to refineOrNull() (the flag is set automatically if refineOrNull() fails).

    Author:
    braz

      Returns current (latest) version of computed value, without attempting to refine it.
      boolean hasMoreRefinedValueSinceLastTimeAtNoCost(java.lang.Object subscriber)
      Indicates whether there have been any refinements since the last time a value has been provided to subscriber (that is, if a more refined value than the last one can be provided at no cost).
      boolean refineIfPossible()
      Attempts to refine the value, returning an indication of whether that has been possible.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentValue

        public T getCurrentValue(java.lang.Object subscriber)
        Description copied from interface: Refiner
        Returns current (latest) version of computed value, without attempting to refine it. It takes a subscriber into account so that it can later tell, with Refiner.hasMoreRefinedValueSinceLastTimeAtNoCost(Object), whether there have been any refinements since the last time a value has been provided to the subscriber (that is, if a more refined value than the last one can be provided at no cost).
        Specified by:
        getCurrentValue in interface Refiner<T>
        Parameters:
        subscriber - a subscriber to the refiner.
        Returns:
        the current version of a computed value, without attempting to refine it.

      • hasMoreRefinedValueSinceLastTimeAtNoCost

        public boolean hasMoreRefinedValueSinceLastTimeAtNoCost(java.lang.Object subscriber)
        Description copied from interface: Refiner
        Indicates whether there have been any refinements since the last time a value has been provided to subscriber (that is, if a more refined value than the last one can be provided at no cost).
        Specified by:
        hasMoreRefinedValueSinceLastTimeAtNoCost in interface Refiner<T>
        Parameters:
        subscriber - a subscriber to the refiner.
        Returns:
        true if there have been any refinements since the last time a value has ben provided to the given subscriber.

      • refineIfPossible

        public boolean refineIfPossible()
        Description copied from interface: Refiner
        Attempts to refine the value, returning an indication of whether that has been possible.
        Specified by:
        refineIfPossible in interface Refiner<T>
        Returns:
        true if it was possible to refine the value, false otherwise.
